meanings.definition: Engaging in excessive trading of stocks or other securities.
meanings.sent1: He was warned about overtrading, but he couldn't resist the urge to buy and sell constantly.
meanings.sent2: Some investors overtrade in an attempt to make quick profits, but it can be risky.
meanings.sent3: The stockbroker joked that he was overtrading so much, he might as well set up a trading desk in his sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her overtrading habits were like a whirlwind, constantly buying and selling without pause.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of overtrading hit him hard when he realized he had lost a significant portion of his savings.

meanings.definition: Conducting business with insufficient capital or resources.
meanings.sent1: The company's overtrading practices eventually led to bankruptcy due to lack of financial stability.
meanings.sent2: Overtrading businesses often struggle to meet their financial obligations on time.
meanings.sent3: It was a comical sight to see the overtrading entrepreneur trying to juggle multiple projects with limited resources.
meanings.sent4: The overtrading company was like a ship sailing in rough waters without a proper anchor.
meanings.sent5: The risks of overtrading without adequate resources can sink a business faster than expected.
